data.name: ADAPTER_EXCEPTION
data.value: An exception occurred whilst getting your adapters, please refer to the error log.

data.name: API_CLIENT_AUTHENTICATE_EXCEPTION
data.value: Something is wrong with the CyberSniff client. Please report this to a developer and wait for an update

data.name: API_FORGED_REQUEST
data.value: Couldn't verify the authenticity of the CyberSniff API response. Therefore we cannot authenticate you. This could be the result of having a HTTP web debugger open, like Fiddler that may tamper with the certificate. Close any web debuggers and try again.

data.name: API_OFFLINE
data.value: We were unable to reach the CyberSniff servers for communication. Please check your internet connection or try again later.

data.name: API_USER_AGENT
data.value: CyberSniff-OSS/3.2

data.name: APP_STAGE
data.value: RELEASE OSS

data.name: AUTH_THREAD_EXITED
data.value: The authentication thread has exited unexpectedly. This could be due to antivirus software or due to software tampering tools being active. Please restart CyberSniff.

data.name: BACKGROUND_LOAD_EXCEPTION
data.value: Couldn't load your background, it may have been moved, renamed or deleted.

data.name: CAPTURE_ACTIVE_EXIT
data.value: You are currently capturing traffic, are you sure you want to exit CyberSniff?

data.name: CAPTURE_EXCEPTION
data.value: Sorry for the inconvenience, but CyberSniff has crashed (failed to start capture). Please contact support, or try again later. More error information can be found in the 'cybersniff.log' file, in '%appdata%\CyberSniff'.

data.name: COPY_EXCEPTION
data.value: Failed to copy to clipboard, please make sure you select a item on the list to copy.

data.name: CRYPTO_EXCEPTION
data.value: Failed to encrypt / decrypt data. This may be a sign of memory corruption. Restart CyberSniff and try again.

data.name: EXCEPTION_BASIC
data.value: Something went wrong, it has been written to the log file.

data.name: GENERIC_EXCEPTION
data.value: Sorry for the inconvenience, but CyberSniff has crashed. The error can be viewed below. It has been dumped to a log file which can be found in '%appdata%\CSniffOSS\cybersniff.log'. Use this file to report this problem to developers.

data.name: INVALID_FILE_SELECTED
data.value: You selected an invalid file. Please select a valid file instead.

data.name: LOGOUT_CONFIRM
data.value: Are you sure you want to logout of CyberSniff? All settings and account data will be removed from your PC.

data.name: LOG_WRITE_EXCEPTION
data.value: Failed to write log file changes to the disk, please make sure another program is not using the log file, that CyberSniff has permission to access the file or check your antivirus software.

data.name: PCAP_DRIVER_EXCEPTION
data.value: We couldn't find Npcap or WinPcap installed on your device which is required to use CyberSniff. Please download and install it from https://nmap.org/npcap

data.name: SETTINGS_READ_EXCEPTION
data.value: Unable to read your settings, this may mean your settings is corrupted or unsupported. As a result, your settings have been reset.

data.name: SETTINGS_WRITE_EXCEPTION
data.value: Unable to save your settings, the settings file may be in use by another process or CyberSniff might not have access to the settings file.

data.name: THEME_APPLY_EXCEPTION
data.value: You specified a invalid color, therefore CyberSniff cannot apply it.

data.name: UI_ABOUT_BOX
data.value:
CyberSniff-OSS was developed by CyberVision Interactive, this build is OSS on GitHub! https://github.com/CyberSniffDeveloper/desktop-client. Credits:
If you paid for this software after 02/07/2022, you have been scammed and you should demand your money back!

data.name: UI_CLEAR_SUCCESS
data.value: Successfully cleared all results.

data.name: UI_COPY_SUCCESS
data.value: Successfully copied to clipboard.

data.name: UPDATE_AVAILABLE
data.value: There is a CyberSniff update available, please update to that version before continuing

data.name: UPDATE_EXCEPTION
data.value: Sorry for the inconvenience, but an exception has occurred whilst contacting the CyberSniff update server. This could be a issue with the server itself. Make sure you are connected to the internet, or try again later.
